result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan S. Petit

records.addlTxt:
04:02 PM Defendant, Nathan S. Petit appeared. Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video means for Defendant Nathan S. Petit. Prosecuting Atty Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and apperances. 

22CM4-Waived reading-Not guilty plea entered. 


Court questions the defendant re: the plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. 


Agreement reached in 21CM20

Count 1-DRI

Count 2-Defendant pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. Defendant makes statement. 

Count 3-DRI

22CM4-DRI

State speaks re: sentencing. Atty Murphy makes statement. 

Sentencing

18 months probation + costs & domestic assessment

AODA Assessment
Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed.
Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption only on premises. 
No abusive contact w/ C.M unless approved by the agent.


6 days credit.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Michael Murphy

w/ $1,000 signature bond.

No contact w/ C.L.M.
Absolute Sobriety. Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed or possess any alcohol.
Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on premises.

Court calls case and appearances. Defendant appears in custody via video from the Washburn County Jail.  State appears by Sheila Yohnk. Atty Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appears for the defendant. Court finds probable cause. Court questions the defendant.

Mailing address:
103 Courture Ave.
Rice Lake, WI 54868

#715-651-5562 

Defendant current on a probation hold. Defendant does qualify for a public defender. 
State requests a $250.00 cash bond w/ No Contact w/ C.M and absolute sobriety. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes argument.
Court sets bond. 

Initial Appearance: February 7th @ 4:00
